attributes.action: Decriminalise not having a TV license
attributes.additional_details:
"In England and Wales there are 180,000 prosecutions a year for failing to pay the licence fee, and dozens of people are jailed each year."
See:
http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/599049/TV-Licence-jailed-England-BBC-fee-Scotland-fines

I do not own a TV and yet I receive regular upsetting letters - about once every 2 months. They say things like ' What to expect in court'. Clearly designed to cause distress.

Decriminalising will reduce the distress caused to millions.
attributes.background:
Thousands of poor people are being imprisoned or given criminal records every year for a minor debt to the BBC. 

Usually, cases of a debt are dealt with by a civil action which is more proportionate.

The BBC employs tactics to frighten people who do not have a TV into buying a license.
